boone.training

Class TrainingSignalGenerator.SquareError

  • java.lang.Object
    • boone.training.TrainingSignalGenerator
      • boone.training.TrainingSignalGenerator.SquareError
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Storable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Enclosing class:
    TrainingSignalGenerator

    public static class TrainingSignalGenerator.SquareError
extends TrainingSignalGenerator
    Square error function. Default for the Backprop trainer types (BackpropTrainer, RpropTrainer). The error term that is used is
    E = 1/2 (t - o)2 .
    However, this function is not needed here. Instead, the Backprop trainers expect the value of a specific part of the derivative of this function. Specifically, the weight update Δw for the above error function is:
    Δw = - η ⋅ ∂E/∂w, thus
    Δw = - η ⋅ (t - o) ⋅ - 1 ⋅ ∂o/∂w
    The back-propagation trainers only expect
    error signal = (t - o)
    as the so-called "error signal". The rest of the term, "- η ⋅ - 1 ⋅ ∂o/∂w", does not need to be calculated. So for example, if another error term
    E = 1/2 (t - o2)2
    was used, the weight change would be
    Δw = - η ⋅ ∂E/∂w = - η (t-o2) * - 2 o * ∂o/∂w
    and this function would need to return
    error signal = (t - o2) ⋅ 2 o .
    Note: To get some sort of classification error function, set the minError to 0.5 . This isn't strictly correct, mathematically, but maybe sufficient; the effect is that instead of (t - o), a classification error Ec is returned, which is
    Ec = { if (t - o) < 0.5 then 0; else (t - o) } .

    • Method Detail

      • calculateSignal

        public void calculateSignal(NeuralNet net,
                            java.util.List<java.lang.Double> target,
                            double minError)
        Calculates and sets the error signal for each output neuron to (target - output).
        Specified by:
        calculateSignal in class TrainingSignalGenerator
        Parameters:
        net - the neural network that has been innervated.
        target - the desired network target output. May be null, if this is e.g. unsupervised learning.
        minError - smallest error that isn't considered as zero. If this parameter isn't needed, it should be ignored.
        See Also:
        TrainingSignalGenerator.SquareError, TrainingSignalGenerator.calculateSignal(boone.NeuralNet, java.util.List<java.lang.Double>, double)
